ygData.subject: Adding only feed-forward connections
ygData.msgSnippet: It turns out that supporting feed-forward networks isn t as easy as I d hoped. I naively assumed that if I modified the add connection routine to only add

Subject: Adding only feed-forward connections
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=127853030; y=ugNSDDujmrJ_sgqvPJR-R32_-MNIwlOGHZr28R-7gT4_KjbMcXqW
X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod


It turns out that supporting feed-forward networks isn't as easy as I'd 
hoped. I naively assumed that if I modified the 'add connection' routine 
to only add connections where the source neuron's innovation # was less 
than the target's [with a bit of added complexity around the input and 
output neurons] that this would do the job.

Unfortunately I noticed that some connections were still going back into 
the net. This of course is due to the way we add new neurons by 
splitting connections, which means that new neurons with high innovation 
#'s are placed throughout the network and often before neurons with 
lower innov #'s. It seems obvious to me now of course :)

So it seems I need some other mechanism to ensure new conenctions are 
all feed-forward and because of the optimisations in my exiting genome 
code it is now quite rigid, or at least if I start hacking around in 
there I risk disturbing the optimsations. No I think I'll defer this 
work for now, what I want to do is allow for easy plugging-in of 
alternative genome classes which is something not quite in place right 
now. However, as part of this I want to do a more wide ranging change 
which would be to expand the ANN model in use to allow for neurons with 
multiple incoming connections. The standard single connection point 
neurons then just become a special case (I think!).

Of course that could potentially take a while so I'll be thinking about 
wrapping up everything I've done to-date and releasing some code in the 
next day or so.

Colin.
